page.title: 0105000129, GENERAL SURVEY
page.content: {The area lies in part of the county of {West Sussex}just south of the Surrey border and includes the village of {Plaistow,}an area of private housing known as{Ifold}and{part of the village {of Loxwood}with associated farms and farmland. Originally part of the{Weald Forest, the area is still well wooded. The {soil is heavy Wealden Clay.} It is difficult to traverse when wet but is fertile and good crops can be grown in favourable weather. There are a number of ponds which form a feature of the area and to the East it is drained by a tributary of the{River {Arun}known as the "Lok" or "Chid". {The population contains a large {proportion of people who commute to {work}in London or the larger nearby towns. There are rail services nearby and a good road link to London.
